source_sentence: 大方等大集經菩薩念佛三昧
translation: Bodhisattva's Nianfo Samādhi from the Great Collection Sutra

source_sentence: 分卷第二
translation: second fascicle

source_sentence: 隋天竺三藏達磨笈多譯
translation: Sui Translation of the Tianzang Tripiṭaka Dharmagupta

source_sentence: 不空見本事品之餘
translation: not void of the Chapter of Ability to See

source_sentence: 「復次，不空見！
translation: "Again, not an empty vision!

source_sentence: 彼精進王以慈愛憐愍多好行檀，常為大會無礙施主，天下所有沙門、婆羅門、貧窮、疾病、諸乞求者，隨須給與，無有休厭。
translation: Because of his loving kindness and compassion and his many good actions, that zealous king is always the unhindered donor of a great assembly of ascetics, priests, the poor, the sick, and those who ask for anything under the sun, and he gives as much as he needs without rest.

source_sentence: 「復次，不空見！
translation: "Furthermore, Amogha-darśana!

source_sentence: 彼精進王凡所統領八萬四千城邑、聚落，皆是淨業勝因所感，七寶合成。
translation: Whatever 84,000 cities and villages the zealous king leads, they are all made up of seven treasures that are the result of excellent causes of pure activity.

source_sentence: 於諸城上一一復造八萬四千栴檀樓觀、諸門、左右亭傳、路次，悉有堂舍，眾寶莊嚴。
translation: On top of each of those cities, he builds 84,000 sandalwood buildings and mansions, gates, left and right pavilions, and roadways, and they all have halls and dwellings adorned with various treasures.

source_sentence: 門無晝夜，常開不閉，以擬一切等獲大安。
translation: The gates are always open and not closed, day and night, so that they can prepare all of them for great peace.

source_sentence: 又諸城內衢巷、街陌，恒然燈燭有大光明，令彼人民各力為作，同共受斯安隱快樂。
translation: In addition, in the city's streets and lanes, there are lamps and candles that shine brightly at all times, causing each of the people to work together to experience this peace and happiness.

source_sentence: 「復次，不空見！
translation: "Furthermore, it's not an empty vision!

source_sentence: 彼精進王時有二子，一名師子，二名師子意，諸根明利，身相圓滿，有大威德，具足神通，皆已先發阿耨多羅三藐三菩提心。
translation: At the time, that king of zeal had two sons, one named Shizi and the other Shizi's mind, whose faculties were sharp and clear, whose bodies were perfectly proportioned, who had great authority, and who were fully endowed with supernormal powers, and who had first aroused the mind of unsurpassed, correct, and complete enlightenment.

source_sentence: 「復次，不空見！
translation: "Furthermore, Bukong sees!

source_sentence: 當爾之時，有佛、世尊，號曰寶聚如來、應供、等正覺、明行足、善逝、世間解、無上士、調御丈夫、天人師、佛、世尊，出現於世，常為天、人、梵、魔、沙門、婆羅門、諸龍、夜叉、乾闥婆、阿修羅、乃至一切人非人等宣明正法，初、中、後善，義味深奧，其文亦善，純備無雜，清白梵行。
translation: At the time, there was a Buddha, a world-honored one, named the Jeweled Tathāgata, Worthy of Offerings, Perfectly Enlightened, Perfect in Knowledge and Conduct, Well Gone, Understander of the World, Unsurpassed Person, Trainer, Teacher of Gods and People, a Buddha, a world-honored one, who appeared in the world and always taught the right Dharma to gods, humans, Brahmā, Māra, ascetics, priests, nāgas, yakṣas, gandharvas, asuras, and all humans and nonhumans, explaining the first, middle, and last good, profound in meaning and good in words, pure and unadulterated, and pure in religious practice.

source_sentence: 「復次，不空見！
translation: "Furthermore, Amoghavajra!

source_sentence: 時彼寶聚如來、應供、等正覺常與七十二億百千諸大聲聞——皆阿羅漢，具足神通、有大威德——近善住城說法教化。
translation: That jeweled cluster of Tathāgatas, Arhats, and Fully Awakened Ones was always accompanied by 7,200,000,000 great śrāvakas-all arhats, fully endowed with supernormal powers and possessing great authority-who approached the Well-Established City to teach and preach.

source_sentence: 「復次，不空見！
translation: "Furthermore, Amoghavajra!

source_sentence: 爾時，寶聚如來、應供、等正覺即於食時著衣持鉢，與彼七十二億百千大聲聞眾前後圍遶，威容詳雅，入善住城次第乞食。
translation: At the time, the Jeweled Tathāgata, Worthy of Offerings, and Completely Enlightened One put on their robes and bowls at mealtime, surrounded by 7,200,000,000 śrāvakas, entered the Well-Established City, and begged for food in order, with a dignified and elegant appearance.

source_sentence: 「彼精進王適與二子在高樓上，遙望見彼寶聚如來大眾圍遶，端嚴殊特，威德巍巍。
translation: "That king of zeal was up on a high building with his two sons, and they looked out and saw that jeweled mass of Tathāgatas surrounded by them, their dignity and special features and their imposing qualities.

source_sentence: 行人觀覩莫不樂見，諸根清淨，心慮澹然，上下調伏勝奢摩陀，到於第一功德彼岸，具足圓滿一切種地。
translation: Everyone who sees it is delighted to see it, their faculties are purified, their minds are calm, and their up-and-down composure is superior to that of śamatha, which brings them to the other shore of the highest virtue and fully completes all the various stages.

source_sentence: 「王既見已，生奇特心，喜勇無量，即與二子取諸華鬘、塗香、末香、及餘名香俱出宮門，速疾持詣寶聚如來、應供、等正覺所奉獻供養佛及大眾，頂禮佛足，却住一面。
translation: "After he saw this, the king was struck with wonder and immeasurable joy, so he and his two sons took some flowers, perfume, powdered incense, and other famous incense and left the palace, quickly carried them to the place where the Tathāgata, the Worthy One, and the Completely Awakened One offer their sacrifices to the Buddha and the assembly, paid homage to the Buddha's feet, and withdrew to one side.

source_sentence: 「復次，不空見！
translation: "Furthermore, Amoghavajra!

source_sentence: 彼精進王及其二子，即便要請寶聚如來與諸大眾盡形供養——所謂衣服、器具、飲食、醫藥——凡是所須悉皆奉給，庶事隆厚，聖眾獲安。
translation: Even as he and his two sons asked the Jeweled Tathāgata and the whole assembly to make all the offerings-such as clothing, utensils, food, and medicine - whatever was necessary, they all gave them, and the services were abundant, so the noble people were made comfortable.

source_sentence: 是精進王與其二子，宿植德本常求佛法，今既遭逢又蒙受請，心生歡喜，慶幸特深。
translation: The zealous king and his two sons, who had long cultivated virtue and had always sought the Buddha's teachings, were delighted to see them now and to be invited, and their hearts were filled with joy and happiness.

source_sentence: 「復次，不空見！
translation: "Furthermore, see that they are not in vain!

source_sentence: 時彼寶聚如來、應供、等正覺於天人中說法教化，所應作已，便於中夜入無餘涅槃。
translation: After teaching and educating the gods and humans as they should, that jeweled cluster of Tathāgatas, Worthy of Offerings, and Completely Awakened Ones then entered nirvāṇa without remainder in the middle of the night.

source_sentence: 「不空見！
translation: "Vision of nonemptyness!

source_sentence: 時精進王聞彼世尊般涅槃已，即與夫人及其二子，躬率群臣及諸民眾，詣彼世尊般涅槃處。
translation: After hearing about the Bhagavān's parinirvāṇa, the king of zeal, together with his wife and their two sons, led a group of ministers and the people to the Bhagavān's parinirvāṇa site.

source_sentence: 至已，敬禮世尊足下，悲號啼哭、椎胸大叫，舉身投地如樹中摧，躄地宛轉而傷歎曰：『世尊滅度一何駛哉？
translation: When they arrived, they bowed their heads at the Bhagavān's feet, wailed and cried out in pity, beat their chests, threw themselves to the ground like trees being destroyed, lamented in dismay as they tumbled to the ground, and said, 'What a relief it is that the Bhagavān has ceased to exist!'

source_sentence: 大聖涅槃，遺棄我等；世間方盲，導師長逝；眾生貧困，商主告終；世界將昏，慧燈忽滅。』
translation: The great sage has gone into nirvāṇa and abandoned us; the world has gone blind, and the teacher has long since passed away; sentient beings are impoverished, and the merchant has ended; the world is about to become dark, and the lamp of wisdom suddenly goes out.'

source_sentence: 「不空見！
translation: "Amogha-darśana!

source_sentence: 彼精進王如是追慕，極悲歎已，方與二兒詣世尊所，以諸香水沐浴聖身，復用眾香遍塗尊體，更以種種殊異華鬘、微妙樂音盡虔供養，然後方用迦尸迦衣妙疊纏裹，安處金棺及以鐵槨，其棺又以七寶雜廁。
translation: After he had thus adored and greatly admired him, that zealous king then went with his two sons to the Bhagavān, bathed the holy body in perfume, rubbed the body of the Bhagavān with various kinds of fragrances, and made reverent offerings with a variety of unusual flowers and subtle musical sounds.

source_sentence: 如是盛置彼佛身已，方聚清淨赤妙栴檀——高一由旬，縱廣正方一拘盧舍——散諸種華及以華鬘，燒然殊勝塗末香等，灌以蘇油，然後起火闍維寶聚如來色身。
translation: After thus enshrining the Buddha's body, it then gathers a pure, red, and marvelous sandalwood - a yojana high and a kuruśa long and wide - scatters various kinds of flowers and flower garlands, burns a magnificent incense scent, pours oil on it, and then starts a fire to gather the Tathāgata's form in a jhāpita.

source_sentence: 「復次，不空見！
translation: "Furthermore, Amoghavajra!

source_sentence: 時彼王子師子既見如來般涅槃已，如是思惟：『天人大師捨我滅度，我於今日何義苟存？
translation: After he saw the Tathāgata's parinirvāṇa, that prince lion thought, 'What point would I have in staying alive today if the great teacher of the gods had abandoned me and ceased to exist?'

source_sentence: 今我若獲隨從如來、應供、等正覺而取滅度，豈不樂哉？』
translation: Wouldn't it be nice if I were to follow the Tathāgata, Worthy of Offerings, and Completely Enlightened and attain extinction?'

source_sentence: 「不空見！
translation: "Not an empty vision!

source_sentence: 時彼王子如是念已，用諸名香自塗其身，復以諸香熏其衣服，以[疊*毛]纏裹，然後周圍放大猛火焚燒其身。
translation: After he thus thought, the prince coated himself with famous incense, perfumed his clothes with it, wrapped them in [bundles of *hair], and then surrounded himself with a great fire that burned his body.

source_sentence: 火熾盛已，師子方於猛焰之中發大弘誓救諸眾生，歌讚歸依如來功德，以偈頌曰：「『世間寶中最尊上，　　今日放捨入無餘；　　天人大師轉法輪，　　我等從此不復覩。
translation: When the fire was burning brightly, the lion then aroused a great vow to save all sentient beings in the midst of the raging flames, sang praises of the merits of relying on the Tathāgata, and composed a verse, "Most honored among the world's treasures, today I released into oblivion no more; the great teacher of the gods turned the wheel of the Dharma, and we've never seen it again.

source_sentence: 法王利益無量眾，　　今已棄置入涅槃；　　吼宣如是大菩提，　　長不復見眾圍遶。
translation: The king of the Dharma benefited measureless multitudes, but now he has abandoned them and entered nirvāṇa; roaring, he proclaims this great enlightenment, never again to be seen surrounded by multitudes.

source_sentence: 不可思議大導師，　　說法能令聞者喜，　　一切天人、諸魔、梵，　　從今永絕不聞聲；　　能施貧窮法財寶，　　為眾演說皆樂聞，　　諸天、龍、鬼、人非人，　　自此長往無歸趣。
translation: He's an unfathomably great teacher who speaks the Dharma to the delight of those who hear him, so all gods, humans, Māra, and Brahmā will never hear his voice again; he can bestow the treasures of the poor Dharma and wealth, and he teaches them for the enjoyment of all who hear him, so gods, dragons, ghosts, humans, and non-humans will go on from here without refuge.

source_sentence: 世間從今無所依，　　偏悼我王何恃怙？
translation: From now on, the world has no support, so why should I, the king, be relied upon?

source_sentence: 并師子意失覆護，　　永不聞佛說法音。
translation: "Even as the lion's mind loses its protection, I'll never hear the Buddha's voice in teaching the Dharma.

source_sentence: 我寧捐軀及壽命，　　無用獨住於世間，　　以是今滅所愛身，　　因茲更廣弘誓願。
translation: I'd rather sacrifice my body and life, uselessly abiding alone in the world, so that I might now extinguish the body I love and cause this to expand my vow.

source_sentence: 我於佛所種善根，　　父王亦常尊三寶，　　先願以此諸功德，　　令王及我證法身。
translation: I planted good roots in the Buddha's place, and my father always honored the Three Treasures, hoping that these virtues would enable the king and me to realize the Dharma body.

source_sentence: 於不思議諸佛所，　　供養修行眾善業，　　普願群生同斯福，　　亦令我誓無虛言。
translation: At the inconceivable buddha-places, I made offerings and cultivated many good deeds, wishing that all sentient beings would share this merit, and making my vow true.

source_sentence: 世尊滅度我焚身，　　其有得聞或親見，　　一切皆同等正覺，　　非彼現在身證者。
translation: If the Bhagavān extinguishes my incinerated body, then anyone who hears or personally sees it will be equally and correctly enlightened, not someone who personally realizes it in the present.

source_sentence: 若人覺悟及夢中，　　但令見我今所作，　　彼必成佛無有疑，　　非彼現在身證者。
translation: If someone awakens or dreams, but they see what I've done now, they'll surely become a buddha without doubt, not someone who personally realizes it now.

source_sentence: 我此愛身終敗壞，　　事同水沫無堅牢，　　願彼食我諸蟲獸，　　皆得速成菩提道。
translation: My body of desire will eventually perish, and things will be like foam in water that has no firmness, so may all the insects and animals that eat me quickly achieve the path to enlightenment.

source_sentence: 今我誓行精進事，　　或有毀罵或輕訶，　　令我速得調御師，　　非彼現在身證者。
translation: Now, I vow to conduct myself with energy, but if I'm criticized or ridiculed, I'll quickly attain a teacher who tames me, not someone who personally realizes it in the present.

source_sentence: 我求無上正覺時，　　其或慈心相觀視，　　即於世間疾成佛，　　非彼現在身證人。
translation: When I seek unsurpassed perfect enlightenment, perhaps I'll look at it with kindness and consideration, and I'll quickly become a buddha in the world, not someone who personally realizes it now.

source_sentence: 我今所願及未發，　　為是焚燒所愛身，　　若此誠誓必不虛，　　令我還見滅度佛。
translation: Now, I've vowed and yet to vow, to burn the body I love in order to make sure this sincere vow isn't in vain, so that I'll see the Buddha of Nirvana again.

source_sentence: 如我暫得覩世尊，　　何異天師重出世？
translation: If I were to see the Bhagavān for a moment, wouldn't it be like a celestial teacher reappearing in the world?

source_sentence: 今我雖復盛焦然，　　猶冀身存得觀佛，　　世尊智慧無障礙，　　常轉三世清淨輪。
translation: 'Now, even though I'm still very anxious, I still hope to be able to observe the Buddha while I'm still alive, for the Bhagavān's wisdom is unimpeded, and he always turns the pure wheel of the three times.

source_sentence: 如昔廣利諸眾生，　　令我見佛從火起，　　濟世大師若暫起，　　如先威力普眼尊。』
translation: As in the past, he gave broad benefit to sentient beings, causing me to see the Buddha arise from the fire. If the great teacher who helped the world had risen momentarily, he would have been like the honored one who had seen the whole world with his authority.'

source_sentence: 佛知師子心精誠，　　為之暫起視神力，　　廣與世間興變事，　　令無量眾厭患身，　　畢竟利益諸眾生，　　還復焚身入寂處。
translation: Knowing the lion's sincerity, the Buddha gave him a momentary appearance of miraculous powers, created a wide range of worldly transformations, caused measureless multitudes to become disillusioned with the body, and ultimately benefited all sentient beings before burning his body back into extinction.

source_sentence: 大眾覩佛巨神變，　　以清淨意讚妙音：　『諸佛妙法難思議，　　戒及禪定亦復然，　　智慧解脫不可量，　　神通變化亦難測，　　雖已滅度能淨我，　　今故歸命焰熾身。
translation: Seeing the Buddha's enormous miraculous transformation, the large crowd praised the wonderful voice with a pure intention, 'The Buddha's marvelous teaching is unfathomable, as are his precepts and meditation, his wisdom and liberation are immeasurable, his psychic powers and transformations are unfathomable, and even though he has ceased to be able to purify himself, he now returns to his flaming body for his life.'

source_sentence: 世尊威德無有比，　　神通已達彼岸邊，　　滅度能令生厭離，　　今我歸依普眼觀。
translation: The Bhagavān's authority has no equal, his supernormal powers have reached the limit of the other shore, his deliverance has caused birth to be disillusioned, and I now take refuge in the contemplation of the universal eye.

source_sentence: 慈悲一切最尊勝，　　能以自心知他心，　　悉治無邊界眾生，　　歸命無等善逝者。
translation: Most honored in compassion for all, he can know the minds of others with his own mind, completely treat sentient beings in an infinite realm, and take refuge in the unequalled One who is well gone.

source_sentence: 於諸醫中第一尊，　　常以妙藥施眾生，　　能除無量眾病苦，　　歸命憐愍救護人。
translation: He's the most honored among doctors, always bestowing wonderful medicines on sentient beings, able to remove measureless illnesses, and taking refuge in the compassionate protector.

source_sentence: 以我稱讚諸善根，　　恭敬供養諸功德，　　放捨愛身所獲福，　　先願利益諸眾生。』
translation: Because I praise these good roots, I respect and offer up merits, and relinquish the merits I've gained from loving myself, I first wish to benefit all sentient beings.'

source_sentence: 「不空見！
translation: "Amogha-darśana!

source_sentence: 時彼王子師子發斯大願以自莊嚴，然後增火卒捨身命。
translation: That prince Shizi then made this great vow to adorn himself, and then he increased the fire and abandoned his life.

source_sentence: 時諸世間天、人、梵、魔、沙門、婆羅門、乃至一切人非人等，見斯事已，咸於世間生重厭離。
translation: When gods, humans, Brahmā, Māra, ascetics, priests, and all humans and nonhumans in the world see this, they all become gravely disillusioned with the world.

source_sentence: 「復次，不空見！
translation: "Furthermore, they don't see emptiness!

source_sentence: 時彼王子捨身命已，即生梵天作大梵王，於諸梵中最尊、最勝，有大威德、具大神通。
translation: After he gave up his life, that prince was born in the Brahma Heaven and became the king of the Brahmas, the most honored and superior of the Brahmas, with great authority and possessing great supernormal powers.

source_sentence: 「不空見！
translation: "Amogha-darśana!

source_sentence: 時彼王子生梵宮已，即自思惟：『我從何處作何善根而來生此，得有如是功德、果報、大神通力？』
translation: After he was born in the palace of Brahmā, that prince thought to himself, 'Where did I make good roots to be born here and attain such merits, rewards, and great supernormal powers?'

source_sentence: 作是念已，便自了了分明見知：『我於人間為精進王子，我與父王眾具供養、恭敬、謌讚寶聚世尊。
translation: After he had this thought, he then knew and clearly saw for himself, 'I was a human prince of effort, and my father and I made offerings to, honored, and praised the Bhagavān, the Jeweled One.

source_sentence: 世尊滅度，我即焚身於彼熾然猛火之中，發大誓願、歎佛功德，以此善根今生梵宮。
translation: When the Bhagavān died, I burned myself in that blazing fire, made a great vow, and praised the merits of the Buddha, and with these good roots I was now born in the palace of Brahmā.

source_sentence: 然我今應還下人間，開慰我父、答所生恩，復當供養寶聚如來入於涅槃燒身處也。』
translation: Now, however, I should go back down to the human world to console my father and repay the kindnesses he received, and I should also make offerings to the Baoglu Tathāgata as he enters the burning place of nirvāṇa.'

source_sentence: 「復次，不空見！
translation: "Furthermore, Amoghavajra!

source_sentence: 時大梵王如是念已，與眷屬天於彼宮沒，猶如壯士屈伸臂頃即至人間，往詣寶聚如來、應供、等正覺闍毘身處，以天眾香——所謂天末旃檀，及天牛頭沈水、多摩羅跋香等——而為供養。
translation: After he thought this, the king of Brahmā and his retinue of gods disappeared from that palace like a stalwart man who flexes his arm and then goes down to the human realm, where the jeweled Tathāgata, the worshipful offerer, the perfectly enlightened Jāmbī, and makes offerings with the fragrances of the gods, such as the fragrance of celestial sandalwood, celestial oxhead sinking water, and the fragrance of tamālapatra.

source_sentence: 復散種種天上妙華——華若車輪，猶雲遍滿——而為供養。
translation: They also scattered various wonderful flowers from the heavens-flowers like chariots and wheels, like clouds all around-to make offerings.

source_sentence: 「師子梵天供養佛已，方慰其父精進王言：『大王當知，王子師子燒身喪命，今我是也，我時即生大梵天中。
translation: "After making these offerings to the Buddha, the lion Brahmā consoled his father, King Jingjin, saying, "Great king, you should know that the prince lion who burned his body and lost his life is now me, and I will be born among the great Brahmā gods.

source_sentence: 願王勿復憂悲痛惱，惟應歡喜，深自慶快。
translation: May the king not be sad and distressed, but rejoice and be deeply pleased with himself.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 王今已獲第一大利。
translation: "Now, the king has attained the greatest benefit.

source_sentence: 所以者何？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 諸佛、世尊難遭難遇，而王已得值遇世尊寶聚如來、應供、等正覺，尊重、恭敬、具足、供養，是為希有第一大利。
translation: The buddhas and world-honored ones are difficult to encounter and difficult to meet, but the fact that the king has met the world-honored, jeweled Tathāgata, Worthy of Offerings, and Completely Awakened One who is respected, venerated, complete, and offered up is the rare and greatest benefit.

source_sentence: 是故，大王！
translation: Therefore, Great King!

source_sentence: 從今已後惟當一心受持是法，弟師子意亦應如是受持此法。
translation: From now on, you must single-mindedly maintain this teaching, and so should my disciples and sons wish to maintain this teaching.

source_sentence: 復應供養世尊舍利，處處流布、廣興塔廟；我於梵宮亦常如是，持斯妙法、尊奉舍利。』
translation: I should also make offerings to the Bhagavān's relics, spread them around, and build stūpas and temples; I'll always do the same at the Brahma palace, maintaining this wonderful Dharma and honoring the relics.'

source_sentence: 如是言已，忽然不現。
translation: After saying this, he suddenly disappeared.

source_sentence: 「復次，不空見！
translation: "Furthermore, Amoghavajra!

source_sentence: 時彼精進王聞梵語故，即與其子師子意者往詣寶聚如來、應、等正覺舍利之所，恭敬、禮拜、歌誦、讚歎，持一切香、一切華鬘、并諸音樂，復持諸種幢幡、寶蓋奉獻供養。
translation: Upon hearing the Brahmā's words, that zealous king went with his son Shizi Yizi to the place where the jeweled relics of the Tathāgata, Ying, and the Completely Awakened One were located, where they were honored, venerated, sung, and praised, carrying all kinds of incense, all kinds of flower garlands, and music, and carrying various banners, streamers, and jeweled shrouds to make offerings.

source_sentence: 「又少時間於彼八萬四千諸城，純以七寶興起八萬四千塔——高一由旬，面各廣長一拘盧舍——殊特端嚴，光耀可愛，安止舍利，咸令供奉。
translation: "A little while later, in 84,000 of those cities, they built 84,000 stūpas made entirely of seven treasures-one yojana high and one krośa long and wide on each side-exceptionally dignified and shining, with lovely splendor, to rest their relics and make offerings to them.

source_sentence: 「又於一一寶塔之所常然八萬四千燈明，各各復以一切名香、一切妙華及以華鬘、一切幢幡、一切寶蓋、一切樂音——鼓、蠃、角、貝、鍾、鈴、磬、鐸——凡是眾具莫不畢備，如是供養，受持是法。
translation: "At each of these jeweled stūpas, 84,000 lamps and lights are always present, and each is decorated with all the famous incense, all the marvelous flowers, all the flower garlands, all the banners and streamers, all the precious canopies, all the musical sounds - drums, trumpets, horns, conchs, bells, chimes, and dulcimers - all of which are fully furnished, so they are offered, and this teaching is upheld.

source_sentence: 「彼精進王以斯善根，於八萬四千劫不生惡道，及師子意亦同果報；王大夫人名曰善意、其最大臣名曰無瞋，亦於八萬四千劫中受勝果報。
translation: "Because of these good roots, that zealous king doesn't give rise to a bad destiny for 84,000 eons, and his lion's will also has the same result; the king's great man named Good Will and his greatest minister named No Anger also receives a superior result for 84,000 eons.

source_sentence: 彼王如是於諸劫中次第供養六萬諸佛，所生常受轉輪王身，正法治化，利益眾生。
translation: Thus, the king makes offerings to each of the 60,000 buddhas in succession throughout the eons, and the person he's born to is always subject to the body of a wheel-turning king who correctly rules and transforms to the benefit of sentient beings.

source_sentence: 「復次，不空見！
translation: "Furthermore, Bukkusen!

source_sentence: 彼寶聚佛滅度之後，時節未幾有一菩薩摩訶薩名普密王，現生世間。
translation: Not long after the extinction of that jeweled cluster of buddhas, there was a bodhisattva Mahāsattva named King Pūrṇa Maitrāyaniputra who was born into the world.

source_sentence: 為世間故，捨家出家，示修苦行，詣菩提樹，坐於道場，以一念慧斷除無明煩惱習氣，即證阿耨多羅三藐三菩提。
translation: For the sake of the world, he left home and renounced the world, showed his austerities, went to the bodhi tree, sat down on the site of enlightenment, and ended the afflictive karmic impressions of ignorance with a single moment of wisdom, which then realized supreme perfect enlightenment.

source_sentence: 「不空見！
translation: "A vision of nonemptyness!

source_sentence: 時彼師子大梵天王以天眼觀，見普密王如來、應供、等正覺出興於世，即復還下住虛空中，持天眾香及以妙華散於佛上，然後至地右遶三周，恭敬合掌，頭面禮拜，勸請世尊轉大法輪。
translation: When that lion king of Brahmā observed with the divine eye that the Tathāgata Bhagavān, the Worthy One, and the Completely Enlightened One had arisen in the world, he went back down and stayed in the sky, scattered a multitude of heavenly incense and marvelous flowers on top of the Buddha, then went to the ground, circled his right three times, put his hands together in respect, bowed his head, and venerated him, and urged the Bhagavān to turn the great wheel of the Dharma.

source_sentence: 時彼師子梵王住於佛前以偈請曰：「『世尊今應闡妙法，　　我等眾生堪聽聞。
translation: That lion king of Brahmā then stayed in front of the Buddha and invited him with a verse, "The Bhagavān should now explain the wonderful Dharma that we sentient beings can hear.

source_sentence: 智慧摧敵今適興，　　一切世間莫能毀，　　如來無上調御者，　　具足至真十種號。
translation: Wisdom that destroys enemies has now arisen, which no one in the world can disparage, and the Tathāgata is an unsurpassed disciplinarian who possesses ten kinds of the most true epithets.

source_sentence: 利世大師今已起，　　自然正覺妙菩提，　　功德圓滿人中上，　　聖智久修非始然。
translation: Now has arisen the great teacher who brings benefit to the world, naturally and accurately realizes the marvelous enlightenment, perfects merit, and is the highest of people, and holy wisdom is cultivated for a long time that's not from the beginning.

source_sentence: 世尊但為演妙音，　　今此大眾樂聞受，　　弘誓本為度世間，　　無歸依者作覆護。
translation: The Bhagavān simply makes a wonderful noise that this crowd enjoys hearing and accepts, making a vast vow originally to save the world and to protect those who don't have any refuge.

source_sentence: 如昔所願今既滿，　　已到寂靜無為處，　　今當速開甘露門，　　能壞三縛出眾惱。』
translation: Now that he has fulfilled his past vows and arrived at the place of quiescence and noncontrivance, he will quickly open the gate of immortality, which will destroy the three fetters and free all sentient beings from affliction.'

source_sentence: 梵王陳請義已周，　　如來於是默然許。
translation: After the Brahma king presented his request for permission, the Tathāgata quietly accepted it.

source_sentence: 於須臾頃普密佛，　　遂令彼梵極歡喜，　　及無量億天人眾，　　以聞善逝轉法輪。
translation: In a moment's time, he universally acknowledged the Buddha and caused the Brahmās to rejoice profusely, along with measureless millions of gods and humans, as they heard Sugata turn the Dharma wheel.

source_sentence: 時彼梵天蒙說已，　　廣持眾具奉報恩，　　於是復發弘誓願：　　『為求無上菩提處，　　今於普密世尊前，　　陳我所作諸功德，　　以此善根所生處，　　常奉十方諸世尊。
translation: After being told this, that Brahma god extensively carried a multitude of implements in return for his kindness, and then he also made a great vow, 'In order to pursue the unsurpassed state of enlightenment, I will now present the merits of what I've done before the Bhagavān Pūrṇa Maitrāyaniputra and use this place of birth of good roots to always serve the world-honored ones in the ten directions.'

source_sentence: 我昔道場供養佛，　　請聽慈說利眾生，　　因是微善凡所居，　　願於佛前常歌讚。』」
translation: I used to make offerings to the Buddha at his place of practice, so I'd like to hear him speak compassionately for the benefit of sentient beings, for this is a place where ordinary people of modest virtue dwell, and I'd like to sing his praises always before the Buddha.'"

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊復告不空見菩薩摩訶薩言：「不空見！
translation: At that point, the Bhagavān again addressed the bodhisattva Mahāsattva Bukongmyeong, saying, "Bukongmyeong!

source_sentence: 時彼精進王子師子梵天以燒身善根得生梵宮，次第供養五千諸佛，聽聞正法，增長善根，常發廣大不思議願。
translation: That prince of zeal, Shizi Brahmā, with the good roots from burning his body, was born in the Brahma palace, made offerings to 5,000 buddhas in succession, heard the right teaching, grew good roots, and always made the vast inconceivable vow.

source_sentence: 不空見！
translation: Not an empty vision!

source_sentence: 汝今當知，爾時無邊精進王者豈異人乎？
translation: Now, you should know, was the king of limitless zeal then someone else?

source_sentence: 即我身是。」
translation: That is, I am this body."

source_sentence: 時彼不空見菩薩復白佛言：「世尊！
translation: Then that Amoghavajra bodhisattva again said to the Buddha, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 彼王二子，師子及師子意者，今何所在？
translation: Where are those two sons of the king, the lion and the lion's wish?

source_sentence: 為於現世供養諸佛？
translation: What is the purpose of making offerings to the buddhas in the present life?

source_sentence: 為已滅度在他世耶？」
translation: Has he ceased to exist in another life?"

source_sentence: 佛言：「不空見！
translation: The Buddha said, "Not an empty vision!

source_sentence: 汝知，爾時王子師子意者，今此彌勒菩薩摩訶薩是；爾時王子師子者，即汝不空見菩薩是也。
translation: "You know that the prince lion at the time was this Maitreya Bodhisattva Mahāsattva, and the prince lion at the time was you, the Amogha-darśana Bodhisattva.

source_sentence: 以汝於彼寶聚如來佛法之中發大誓願一捨身故，能令三萬天人大眾發阿耨多羅三藐三菩提心，彼輩終必證大菩提無有疑也。」
translation: Because you made the great vow to abandon yourself once and for all while you were among the treasured collection of the Tathāgata's teachings, you were able to cause 30,000 gods and humans to arouse the mind of unsurpassed, correct, and complete enlightenment, and they will surely realize great enlightenment without doubt."

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊為重宣此義以偈頌曰：「我觀過去久遠劫，　　佛號寶聚無上尊，　無師自覺現世間，　　能益天人群生類。
translation: The Bhagavān then repeatedly explained this meaning in a verse, "I've observed a long, long time in the past when the Buddha's name was Jewel Cluster, the unsurpassed honored one, the untaught Self-Enlightened One who appeared in the world and was able to benefit a multitude of sentient beings in the heavens.

source_sentence: 具足百福金色相，　　慈心顯發實義門，　開示眾生菩提路，　　吼唱能盡眾苦源。
translation: Possessing a hundred merits and a golden color, his compassionate mind reveals the true meaning of the teaching, shows sentient beings the path to enlightenment, and his voice can end the source of all suffering.

source_sentence: 寶聚挺特人中勝，　　七十二億眾聖賢，　三明、六通、具八解，　　隨佛入城而分衛。
translation: The jeweled heap is superior among men, and there are 7.2 billion sages and worthies with the three kinds of insight, six abilities, and eight understandings who enter the city with the Buddha and guard it.

source_sentence: 我於今日為勝王，　　無邊精進大威力，　恒將二子從左右，　　因巡遊觀處高樓。
translation: Today, I'm the victorious king, boundless in my zeal and great in my might, always bringing my two sons to my right and left as I tour and contemplate the high buildings.

source_sentence: 遙見調伏大仙神，　　比丘僧眾悉圍遶，　我時及子趨疾下，　　馳詣無等尊勝前。
translation: When I saw the great demon god of taming, surrounded by a multitude of monks and nuns, my son and I hurried down and rushed to the presence of the peerless Venerable One.

source_sentence: 既至大師善逝所，　　施設諸種妙供具，　頂禮尊足口發言：　　『啟請如來及僧眾，　衣、食、眾具盡形奉。』
translation: Once we arrived at the great teacher Sugata, we spread out a variety of wonderful offerings, bowed our heads at his feet, and spoke, 'Revel in the Tathāgata and the saṃgha, and offer up all of our clothing, food, and necessities in form.'

source_sentence: 滿足八萬四千年，　并是二子淨信心，　　為求無上菩提故。
translation: Having fulfilled 84,000 years, these two sons purify their faith in order to pursue unsurpassed enlightenment.

source_sentence: 人中極尊既涅槃，　　興起八萬四千塔，　眾寶間廁奇光耀，　　但為人寶遺餘身。
translation: After the most honored among men passed away, he erected 84,000 stūpas, shining brilliantly in the toilets among the many treasures, but leaving behind a body made of human treasures.

source_sentence: 一一城中寶塔所，　　各然無量百千燈，　香華、音樂、鼓、鍾、鈴，　　彼王為佛興斯供。
translation: In each of those jeweled stūpas, there are measureless hundreds of thousands of lamps, fragrant flowers, music, drums, bells, and chimes, and the king makes these offerings to the Buddha.

source_sentence: 因種如是勝善根，　　次第遭遇六萬佛，　悉皆供養親承事，　　為求無上大菩提。
translation: Because he planted such excellent good roots, he encountered 60,000 buddhas in order, making offerings to and serving them all in pursuit of the unsurpassed great enlightenment.

source_sentence: 汝不空見勿復疑，　　曩時統領大地主，　彼深智王我身是，　　其號無邊精進力。
translation: Don't doubt that you don't see emptiness, for in ancient times, that great lord of the earth who ruled, that profoundly wise king I myself am, whose name is boundless in its power of effort.

source_sentence: 常以華香修供養，　　教化一切諸眾生；　具然無量百千燈，　　為世除闇作光明。
translation: He always made offerings with flowers and incense, taught all sentient beings, and possessed measureless hundreds of thousands of lamps, creating light to remove darkness in the world.

source_sentence: 施與財寶未曾休，　　聽聞正法亦無厭，　精進苦行不暫捨，　　為證無上大涅槃。
translation: Never stopping to bestow possessions and treasures, he never tires of hearing the right teaching and never abandons vigorous asceticism in order to realize the unsurpassed great nirvāṇa.

source_sentence: 汝於寶聚如來所，　　以衣纏身火洞然，　猶如燈炷塗膏油，　　須臾火至即熸燼。
translation: At that jeweled gathering of the Tathāgata's, you wrapped a robe around your body and set it on fire, just like a lampwick coated with oily oil that goes out in a moment when the fire reaches it.

source_sentence: 汝時身火熾焰盛，　　毛色無動神不驚，　於彼人寶滅度日，　　爾躬如是為世間。
translation: When your body is ablaze, your hair doesn't budge and your spirit isn't startled, and you do so for the world on the day when that person's treasure ceases to exist.

source_sentence: 猛火如斯煎迫時，　　汝猶方便而勸請：『願見世尊從火起，　　大悲護世現本形。
translation: When that fierce fire was raging, you still skillfully urged it, 'May I see the Bhagavān arise from the fire and show his original form by greatly compassionately protecting the world.

source_sentence: 我今所願成就者，　　方得如意捨身命，　但能暫見如往昔，　　所獲功德不思議。
translation: Now, I want something to be accomplished so that I can freely give up my life, but I can see it for a moment as I did in the past, and the merit I attain is inconceivable.

source_sentence: 我凡所有諸誓言，　　冀其一切皆和會；　若我當來必成佛，　　願於猛焰見世尊。』
translation: All the vows I've made, I hope they'll all come together, and if I'm certain to become a buddha in the future, I'll see the Bhagavān in a blazing fire.'

source_sentence: 佛智清淨無障礙，　　於彼三世坦然平，　照明師子淳淨心，　　佛以精誠從火現。
translation: 'The Buddha's wisdom is pure and unobstructed, his three times are straightforward and level, the illuminating lion is pure and pure, and the Buddha appears through fire with sincerity.'

source_sentence: 不空見！
translation: Not an empty vision!

source_sentence: 此願力持，　　護世須臾應念起，　因茲更發莊嚴誓，　　不思議願實難量。
translation: Sustained by the power of this vow, the momentary remembrance of protecting the world arises, and because of it, he makes a further adorned vow, a vow that's really hard to fathom and inconceivable.

source_sentence: 世尊從彼火起時，　　一切皆得厭離心，　又以淨意發讚音：　　『佛威希有難可測，　無邊相好火盛然。』
translation: When the Bhagavān started that fire, everyone became disillusioned with it, and he uttered this hymn with a pure intention: 'The Buddha's authority is rare and unfathomable, and his limitless attributes are ablaze.'

source_sentence: 法王應念忽便起，　以佛、世尊現神變，　　千數眾得解脫心。
translation: In response to that thought, the Dharma king suddenly arises, and because the Buddha and the Bhagavān show miraculous powers, a thousand multitudes attain a state of mind of liberation.

source_sentence: 汝不空見知師子，　　大慈應感忽還坐，　由見世尊此神變，　　千數眾發菩提心。
translation: You nonempty visionary lion, you were so moved by great kindness that you suddenly returned to your seat, and because you saw this miraculous transformation of the Bhagavān, a thousand multitudes aroused the mind of enlightenment.

source_sentence: 大悲為世利益已，　　還復偃臥猛火中，　師子於是放捨身，　　一念往生大梵處。
translation: After greatly compassionately working for the world's benefit, he returned to lie prostrate in the fierce fire, and the lion then released his body and reborn in the Brahma realm with a single thought.

source_sentence: 即從梵宮還佛所，　　具足供養人中尊，　奉持微妙天華香，　　投散彼佛碎身地。
translation: He then returned from the Brahma palace to the Buddha's abode, made offerings to the most honored among men, and presented him with a scent of subtle celestial flowers, which he cast into the ground to disperse the Buddha's broken body.

source_sentence: 彼寶聚尊涅槃後，　　其間時節無幾何，　復有普密天人師，　　為利世間故興世，　坐於道樹等至真，　　是天中天號大覺。
translation: After that jeweled bundle of saints had passed away, there was no limit to the number of seasons in between, and then there was another teacher of gods and men of universal mystery who arises for the benefit of the world and sits in a tree of the way, just as truly as the gods in the heavens called Mahākauṣṭhila.

source_sentence: 大梵天王設供養，　　恭敬頂禮兩足尊，　請轉法輪利世間，　　佛知心淨默然許。
translation: The king of the Brahmas made offerings, paid homage to the two-legged honored one, asked him to turn the wheel of the Dharma for the benefit of the world, and the Buddha knew his mind was pure and quietly approved.

source_sentence: 梵王聞法大歡慶，　　身得安樂心怡然，　更發殊常大誓願，　　植不思議眾善根。
translation: The king of Brahmā rejoices greatly when he hears the teaching, attains physical well-being, and makes a great vow to plant inconceivably numerous good roots.

source_sentence: 一劫值遇五千佛，　　皆得親承興供養，　智者不應更他疑，　　彼時師子汝即是。
translation: Encountering 5,000 buddhas in a single eon, they all become personally acknowledged and offered up, and you, the wise man, should have no more doubts than others, for you then are the lion.

source_sentence: 不空見時為吾息，　　汝後事佛經五千，　我皆明見汝燒身，　　求斯無上菩提道。
translation: When Amoghasiddhi saw that, he calmed me down, and you later served the Buddha in 5,000 sūtras, and I clearly saw your burning body as you sought this unsurpassed path to enlightenment.

source_sentence: 汝復無量千佛所，　　於彼滅度舍利時，　亦燒無量所愛軀，　　皆為他樂自受苦。
translation: Again, at the time of your extinction as a relic in one of the countless thousand buddha-places, you also burned measureless bodies that you loved, all of which were painful for the pleasure of others.

source_sentence: 我知汝今及異世，　　無量千生長時修，　或佛現在、或涅槃，　　汝常建斯誠實語。
translation: I know that in the present and in other generations, you've cultivated measureless thousands of lifetimes, either during the Buddha's present life or in nirvāṇa, and you've always established this as a sincere statement.

source_sentence: 經昔無量百千生，　　惟我神力能知汝，　不空！
translation: Throughout your countless hundreds of thousands of lifetimes in the past, only my supernormal powers have been able to know you; they're not empty!

source_sentence: 汝久發斯願，　　果報今者皆明現。
translation: You've made this vow for so long that its rewards are now clearly evident.

source_sentence: 汝於諸佛大師前，　　不思議行悉圓滿，　常業歌讚兩足尊，　　苦行熏修諸大誓。
translation: Before the buddhas and great masters, your inconceivable actions were all fully accomplished, your actions were always praised by the two-legged honored ones, and your painful actions were perfumed by the cultivation of great vows.

source_sentence: 今獲偈歎大法王，　　斯由往積勝因緣；　又於普密王佛前，　　攝取最上無邊願。
translation: Now you've attained the great king of the Dharma who praises you in verse because of the excellent causes and conditions you've accumulated in the past, and you've gathered the most excellent and limitless vow before King Bhūtamitra.

source_sentence: 汝今果獲如斯報，　　蒙佛、如來現威神。」
translation: Now, you've attained such a reward, thanks to the Buddha and Tathāgata's authoritative presence."

source_sentence: 時不空見於眾所，　　恭敬合掌頂禮佛，　請問天尊調御師，　　慈悲利益眾生事：「大仙！
translation: Seeing them all, Bukong bowed his head to the Buddha with his palms together in respect, and asked the Bhagavān's teacher, the tamer of the gods, to compassionately benefit all the people, "Great sage!

source_sentence: 我曾何誓願，　　而能捨棄無量生？
translation: "What vow have I made to forgo an unlimited number of lifetimes?

source_sentence: 惟願世尊開少分，　　我蒙聖說乃能了。」
translation: May the Bhagavān reveal a small part of it, so that I can understand it because of the noble teaching."

source_sentence: 「不空！
translation: "Amoghas!

source_sentence: 汝於往昔事，　　吾今為汝粗說之，　汝於雲音如來所，　　已發如是廣大願：『諸佛若證菩提時，　　當令我身常奉覲。』
translation: 'Now, I'll explain for you in detail the events of the past, which you've made this great vow to the Tathāgata Meghasvara: 'When the buddhas realize enlightenment, I will make myself a constant attendant.'

source_sentence: 又於帝幢普眼佛，　　彼時亦發大誓願：『世間若有最導師，　　當令我即同斯道。』
translation: Also, at the time, the Tathāgata Universal Vision Buddha made a great vow, 'If there's a supreme teacher in the world, I will be made to share that path.'

source_sentence: 汝於日燈如來所，　　亦發勝妙諸行願。
translation: At the place of the Sunlamp Tathāgata, you also made the vow to engage in marvelous practices.

source_sentence: 汝不空見惟我知，　　造作眾寶經行處，　或營壯麗佛精舍，　　若搆殊異僧伽藍，　彼皆微妙七寶成，　　一切資具奉諸佛。
translation: You don't see emptiness but I know it, creating places for the practice of sūtras with many treasures, or building magnificent Buddha-houses, or extraordinary saṃghârāma that's made of subtle seven treasures and has all the necessities to serve the Buddha.

source_sentence: 於不思議眾所尊，　　人中師子善生佛，　持七寶蓋及眾具，　　供奉超世天中天。
translation: Venerated by inconceivable people as the lion among men, the well-arisen Buddha carries seven-jeweled lids and a multitude of implements to offer to the gods of gods beyond the world.

source_sentence: 於彼普眼如來所，　　爾時又起妙願行，　廣施燈明眾供調，　　奉獻世間天人師。
translation: At that point, the Tathāgata with the Universal Vision then gives rise to another marvelous vow, extensively bestowing a lamp and numerous offerings, and dedicating it to the gods and humans of the world.

source_sentence: 汝於如是無量佛，　　過千萬億那由他，　自受勤苦安眾生，　　發彼莊嚴弘廣誓。
translation: At these measureless buddhas, you passed a thousand million nayutas, undertook your own hard work to pacify sentient beings, and gave rise to that adorned and vast vow.

source_sentence: 汝於普密王佛前，　　所發誠願我今說：『如其修行成佛者，　　我所散華遍大地。』
translation: Now, I'll tell you the vow you made before King Bhūmi Buddha, 'If he cultivates his practice and becomes a buddha, I'll scatter flowers all over the land.'

source_sentence: 汝於雲雷音佛所，　　為世間故發斯願：『若有眾生聞我名，　　願彼咸即成佛道。』
translation: At the Buddha of Meghasvara, you made this vow for the sake of the world: 'If sentient beings hear my name, may they all immediately become buddhas.'

source_sentence: 復於帝釋幢佛前，　　廣興供養因誓願：『凡我所處若見聞，　　彼彼皆得成佛道。』
translation: Again, in front of the Tissa-banner Buddha, you made a vow that was the cause for making extensive offerings, 'Wherever I'm seen and heard, they'll all attain the Buddhahood.'

source_sentence: 汝於日燈如來所，　　奉施七寶經行處，　無邊威所大明佛，　　汝當爾時發願言：『常施勝處妙莊嚴，　　願我佛剎亦如是。』
translation: At the place where the Sunlight Tathāgata consecrates the place where the sūtras of the seven treasures are carried out, the great luminous Buddha of infinite splendor, you should then make the vow, 'Always bestow marvelous adornment on excellent places, and may my buddha-base be likewise.'

source_sentence: 汝於月上如來所：　　『願得第一最天宮，　佛尊處中而遊化，　　眾生遊者悉成佛。』
translation: At the Tathāgata's residence on the moon, you said, 'May I attain the first and most heavenly palace, where the Buddha travels and converts sentient beings who travel there and become buddhas.'

source_sentence: 汝於澡浴善逝前，　　實作如是至誠願：『若於夏日盛暑時，　　眾生身心離熱惱。』
translation: Before you bathed Sugata, you truly made this sincere vow: 'When the summer sun is hot, sentient beings will be freed from the heat, body and soul.'

source_sentence: 汝於鴦祇羅佛所，　　亦發如是增上願：『恒於長夜黑闇時，　　願施燈明除迷惑。
translation: At Aṅgirasvara Buddha, you also made this superior vow: 'When it's always dark in the long night, may I give a lamp to remove delusion.

source_sentence: 若我捨施身命處，　　其有食肉諸眾生，　必皆成佛無有疑，　　非彼現在身證者。
translation: If I were to relinquish the place of my life, then all the sentient beings who eat meat would surely become buddhas without doubt, not those who personally realize it now.

source_sentence: 或於覺悟及夢裏，　　若有眾生聞我名，　一切成佛無有疑，　　非彼現在身證者。
translation: Perhaps in awakening or in a dream, if there are sentient beings who hear my name, they'll all become buddhas without doubt, not those who personally realize it now.

source_sentence: 汝於勇猛精進時，　　其有愛憎爾所作，　斯等皆當成法王，　　非彼現在得證者。』
translation: When you make vigorous effort, if there are things you like and dislike about them, they will all become Dharma kings, not those who have personally realized them in the present.'

source_sentence: 汝先無量世生處，　　於彼恒願求菩提，　我今說汝實功德，　　當來必獲無上尊。
translation: Where you were born in measureless ages ago and where you've always vowed to achieve enlightenment, I now explain your true merit, and in the future you'll surely attain the unsurpassed honor.

source_sentence: 若有禽獸及餘眾，　　彼必成佛無復疑，　諸是食汝身肉等，　　一切自然證法身。
translation: If there are animals, birds, and other beings, they will surely become buddhas without further doubt, and all of those who eat your flesh will naturally realize the Dharma body.

source_sentence: 我知汝有千數行，　　皆為利益諸眾生，　若有聞者或生疑，　　以時未至我不說。
translation: I know that you have a thousand practices that are meant to benefit sentient beings, but if anyone who hears them has doubts, I won't explain them because the time has not yet come.

source_sentence: 凡我所說汝諸事，　　其或眾生願樂聞，　彼彼得佛必無疑，　　非餘現在身證者。
translation: Whatever I explain about you, if sentient beings are willing to hear it, they certainly won't have doubts about Peter Buddha, not some other person who personally witnessed it in the present.

source_sentence: 若人欲見救世尊，　　轉此清淨勝法輪；　聞已能破諸苦惱，　　為證菩提故樂聞。
translation: If someone wants to see the Bhagavān, who turns this pure, excellent wheel of the Dharma, and after hearing it, they'll be able to break through suffering and distress and gladly hear it in order to realize bodhi, then they'll want to see the Buddha of the three times.

source_sentence: 若人欲見三世佛，　　恭敬供養上福田，　具足積聚諸功德，　　必先受持此三昧。」
translation: If someone wants to see the buddhas of the three times, venerate them, make offerings to the highest field of merit, and fully accumulate all merits, they must first accept and maintain this samādhi."

source_sentence: 為利世間天人故，　　世尊宣說是事已，　遂下法座而徐行，　　即還歸寂於本室。
translation: After preaching this for the benefit of gods and humans in the world, the Bhagavān then descended from his Dharma seat and walked slowly, returning to his quiet abode.

source_sentence: 大方等大集經菩薩念佛三昧分卷第二
translation: Dafangdengdaji jing pusa nianshen fo sanmei fengshi baochang roll 2
